sentence.Network_en: The eighteenth-century Admiralty had few coercive powers over its officers.
sentence.Network_cn: 18世纪的英国海军部对其军官没有什么强制力。

sentence.Network_en: As a coercive measure, arrest system implies the same.
sentence.Network_cn: 逮捕制度作为刑事诉讼的一项强制措施, 当然也是如此.

sentence.Network_en: The dictatorship of the proletariat cannot but be highly coercive.
sentence.Network_cn: 无产阶级专政不能没有很大的强制性.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...是一元化(homogenizing)、规范化(normalizing)的，消除种族、阶级和其他差异，坚持认为所有妇女都渴望实现强制的(coercive)、标准化（standardized）的理想。引人注目的是，在这些失调中，女性气质的建构以具体、夸张的.

entry.def: Coercive measures are intended to force people to do something that they do not want to do.

example.ex: ...increasingly coercive measures on the part of the state...
example.tran: 该州采取的越来越严厉的高压手段

example.ex: The eighteenth-century Admiralty had few coercive powers over its officers.
example.tran: 18世纪的英国海军部对其军官没有什么强制力。

auth_sentence.content: The company will not tolerate coercive and underhand practices.
auth_sentence.res_content: The company will not tolerate coercive and underhand practices.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The company will not tolerate coercive and underhand practices.

auth_sentence.content: Of course they can't participate in coercive interrogations!

auth_sentence.content: But technology and the social changes it ushers in have always been coercive.
